RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the agents: Jorge Luis Trevino and Marco Montemayor

Defendant who challenges the stop of his white sedan by United States Border Patrol Agent Trevino, arguing that the factors known to Agent Trevino at the time of the stop fall short of reasonable suspicion
Defendant whose involuntary transportation to the Border Patrol station for questioning was deemed 'sufficiently like an arrest' and required probable cause
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent with nearly seven years of experience, including a year and a half at the Freer checkpoint, which has led him to recognize most vehicles passing down FM 2050, explained reasonable suspicion analysis during the hearing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security who interviewed Ignacio Rodriguez after he was transported to the checkpoint
